intro: Neomammillaria aljibensis, commonly known as the Aljibén spineless cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, compact cactus with a short, cylindrical stem that rarely branches. The plant produces pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments. Neomammillaria aljibensis is often grown as a decorative cactus due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
